Class DMSImpl

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.BaseObjectImpl
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.ControllerIoImpl
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.DeviceImpl
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.DMSImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<DMSImpl>, SonarObject, ControllerIO, Device, DMS, Storable
public class DMSImpl extends DeviceImpl implements DMS, Comparable<DMSImpl>
Dynamic Message Sign
Author:
Douglas Lau, Michael Darter, John L. Stanley - SRF Consulting

    • createMsg

      public SignMessage createMsg(String ms, String owner, boolean fb, boolean ps, SignMsgPriority mp, Integer dur)
      Create a message for the sign.
      Parameters:
      ms - MULTI string for message.
      owner - Message owner.
      fb - Flash beacon flag.
      ps - Pixel service flag.
      mp - Message priority.
      dur - Duration in minutes; null means indefinite.
      Returns:
      New sign message, or null on error.

    • setMsgNext

      public void setMsgNext(SignMessage sm)
      Set the next sign message. This must be called by operations after getting exclusive device ownership. It must be set back to null after the operation completes. This is necessary to prevent the ReaperJob from destroying a SignMessage before it has been sent to a sign.
      See Also:
      • DeviceImpl.acquire(us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.comm.OpDevice)

    • hasReference

      public boolean hasReference(SignMessage sm)

      public Long getExpireTime()
      Get current message expiration time.
      Specified by:
      getExpireTime in interface DMS
      Returns:
      Expiration time for the current message (ms since epoch), or null for no expiration.
      See Also:
      • System.currentTimeMillis()
